text:
Im doing a UI extension backed by a serverless function.
I got this line of code `const { ENTITIES } = require('./Schema');`  in the top of my function file.
Works great with `hs project dev` but after deploying using `hs project upload` I get :

`2024-02-20T11:04:35.732Z ERROR - Error: Cannot find module './Schema'`

How can I extract serverless function into multiple files here?
is there any reason why I wouldn't be able to make an OpenAI API request through a serverless function?

Anyone having issues with deploying functions via the `hs project upload` and despite the function showing that its' been deployed, when trying to call it, a 404 is shown? In some cases, a deployment has worked successfully, but it's incredibly buggy and its' not always registering the function (which I suspect is using Cloudflare behind the scenes?).
Anyone experience using `hs project watch` and when trying to sync serverless functions seems to default to the old schema in 2023.1?
I know this issue exists: <https://github.com/HubSpot/HubSpot-cli/issues/646> - which is part of the issue, though, doesn't mention anything about the schema mismatch.
Looks like to get around this, renaming the serverless function to something else appears to resolve it temporarily, though, this is very buggy.
